description.zh-cn: 香港政治人物，现任香港特别行政区行政长官兼国家安全委员会主席，是香港历史上首位纪律部队出身的行政长官。曾任警务处副处长、保安局副局长、保安局局长及政务司司长等政府职务。因在反对逃犯条例修订草案运动期间参与镇压示威而被美国制裁。
description.en: A Hong Kong politician and the current Chief Executive of Hong Kong and Chairman of the Committee for Safeguarding National Security. He is the first Chief Executive from a disciplined services background in Hong Kong's history. He previously served as Deputy Commissioner of Police, Under Secretary for Security, Secretary for Security, and Chief Secretary for Administration. He was sanctioned by the United States for his role in suppressing protests during the 2019–2020 Hong Kong protests.

description.zh-cn: 香港政治人物，曾任香港特别行政区第五任行政长官。
description.en: A Hong Kong politician who served as the fifth Chief Executive of Hong Kong.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国国务院

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国务院
en: State Council of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的最高国家行政机关，即中央人民政府。
description.en: The chief administrative authority of the People's Republic of China, which is the Central People's Government.

description.zh-cn: 香港特别行政区政府的决策局之一，负责维持公共秩序、出入境、海关、监狱、消防和救灾等事宜。
description.en: One of the policy bureaus of the Government of Hong Kong, responsible for maintaining public order, immigration, customs, prisons, fire services, and disaster relief.

description.zh-cn: 香港特别行政区政府保安局辖下的纪律部队之一，为香港提供警务服务。
description.en: One of the disciplined services under the Security Bureau of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government, responsible for providing police services in Hong Kong.

description.zh-cn: 香港特别行政区政府中地位仅次于行政长官的政府官员职位。
description.en: The second-highest official position in the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, subordinate only to the Chief Executive.

nodes.id: 香港特别行政区行政长官

zh-cn: 香港特别行政区行政长官

description.zh-cn: 香港特别行政区的政府首长和地区的代表。
description.en: The head of government and representative of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

nodes.id: 2022年香港特别行政区行政长官选举

zh-cn: 2022年香港特别行政区行政长官选举

description.zh-cn: 香港特别行政区举行的第六届行政长官选举，李家超是唯一的候选人并以超过99%的支持票当选。
description.en: The sixth Chief Executive election held in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, where John Lee was the sole candidate and was elected with over 99% of the support votes.

nodes.id: 反对逃犯条例修订草案运动

zh-cn: 反对逃犯条例修订草案运动

description.zh-cn: 于2019年在香港爆发的反对《逃犯条例》修订草案的大规模社会运动。
description.en: A large-scale social movement that erupted in Hong Kong in 2019 against the proposed amendment to the Fugitive Offenders Ordinance.

description.zh-cn: 美利坚合众国，一个北美洲的联邦共和国。
description.en: The United States of America, a federal republic in North America.

description.zh-cn: 由时任美国总统特朗普签署的行政命令，旨在应对香港局势，并授权对相关中国内地及香港官员实施制裁。
description.en: An executive order signed by then-U.S. President Trump concerning the situation in Hong Kong, authorizing sanctions against relevant mainland China and Hong Kong officials.

description.zh-cn: 位于香港的一所天主教男子中学，由耶稣会主办。
description.en: A Catholic all-boys secondary school in Hong Kong, run by the Society of Jesus.

description.zh-cn: 澳大利亚的一所公立大学。
description.en: A public university in Australia.

description.zh-cn: 李家超的妻子，据报道持有英国国籍。
description.en: Spouse of John Lee Ka-chiu, reported to hold British nationality.

description.zh-cn: 李家超的长子，银行家，据报道持有英国国籍。
description.en: The elder son of John Lee Ka-chiu, a banker, reported to hold British nationality.

description.zh-cn: 李家超的幼子，曾投身银行界，后在中国内地开设幼儿园，据报道持有英国国籍。
description.en: The younger son of John Lee Ka-chiu, previously worked in the banking industry and later opened a kindergarten in Mainland China, reported to hold British nationality.

description.zh-cn: 香港政治人物，曾任香港特别行政区第四任行政长官。
description.en: A Hong Kong politician who served as the fourth Chief Executive of Hong Kong.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国最高领导人，现任中国共产党中央委员会总书记、中华人民共和国主席、中央军事委员会主席。
description.en: The paramount leader of the People's Republic of China, currently serving as General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party, President of the People's Republic of China, and Chairman of the Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，曾任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: A Chinese politician who served as the Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，现任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: A Chinese politician currently serving as the Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲联盟的立法、监督和咨询机构。
description.en: The legislative, supervisory, and advisory body of the European Union.

description.zh-cn: 根据《香港特别行政区基本法》第二十三条制定的香港本地法律，旨在维护国家安全。
description.en: A local law in Hong Kong enacted under Article 23 of the Basic Law of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, aimed at safeguarding national security.

description.zh-cn: 香港政治人物，曾任保安局局长。
description.en: A Hong Kong politician who previously served as the Secretary for Security.

description.zh-cn: 香港政治人物，现任保安局局长，曾任警务处处长。
description.en: A Hong Kong politician, currently the Secretary for Security, who previously served as the Commissioner of Police.

description.zh-cn: 香港政治人物，曾任政务司司长。
description.en: A Hong Kong politician who previously served as the Chief Secretary for Administration.

description.zh-cn: 香港政治人物，现任政务司司长。
description.en: A Hong Kong politician currently serving as the Chief Secretary for Administration.

nodes.id: 中央人民政府驻香港特别行政区联络办公室

zh-cn: 中央人民政府驻香港特别行政区联络办公室
en: Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府在香港特别行政区的派出机构。
description.en: The representative office of the Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 一家位于美国的跨国科技公司，Alphabet Inc.的子公司，业务范围涵盖互联网搜索、云计算、广告技术等。
description.en: An American multinational technology company and subsidiary of Alphabet Inc. that focuses on online advertising, search engine technology, cloud computing, and more.

description.zh-cn: 英国政治人物，香港最后一任总督。
description.en: A British politician and the last Governor of Hong Kong.

position.zh-cn: 见习督察至警务处副处长（管理）
position.en: Probationary Inspector to Deputy Commissioner of Police (Management)

relationships.target: 香港特别行政区行政长官

description.zh-cn: 在梁振英担任行政长官期间，李家超任保安局副局长。
description.en: John Lee served as the Under Secretary for Security during Leung Chun-ying's tenure as Chief Executive.

description.zh-cn: 在林郑月娥担任行政长官期间，李家超先后担任保安局局长和政务司司长。
description.en: During Carrie Lam's tenure as Chief Executive, John Lee served successively as Secretary for Security and Chief Secretary for Administration.

description.zh-cn: 李家超作为香港行政长官，向中央人民政府负责，其就职宣誓由中共中央总书记习近平监誓，并需向其述职。
description.en: As the Chief Executive of Hong Kong, John Lee is accountable to the Central People's Government. His oath of office was administered by CCP General Secretary Xi Jinping, to whom he also reports.

description.zh-cn: 李家超接替林郑月娥成为香港特别行政区行政长官。
description.en: John Lee succeeded Carrie Lam as the Chief Executive of Hong Kong.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国国务院

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国务院多次任命李家超担任香港政府要职，包括保安局局长、政务司司长，并批准其辞职参选及最终任命其为行政长官。
description.en: The State Council of the People's Republic of China appointed John Lee to key Hong Kong government positions, including Secretary for Security and Chief Secretary for Administration, approved his resignation to run for election, and ultimately appointed him as Chief Executive.

relationships.source: 中央人民政府驻香港特别行政区联络办公室

description.zh-cn: 在2022年行政长官选举期间，香港中联办向选举委员会委员表示，李家超是中央唯一支持的候选人。
description.en: During the 2022 Chief Executive election, the Hong Kong Liaison Office indicated to Election Committee members that John Lee was the sole candidate supported by the central government.

description.zh-cn: 因在反对逃犯条例修订草案运动期间压制示威，美国财政部宣布对包括李家超在内的11名中港官员实施制裁。此制裁导致其竞选YouTube频道被停用。
description.en: Due to his role in suppressing protests during the anti-extradition bill movement, the U.S. Department of the Treasury announced sanctions against 11 Hong Kong and mainland officials, including John Lee. These sanctions led to the termination of his election campaign's YouTube channel.

description.zh-cn: 美国政府发布第13936号行政命令，授权对损害香港自治的中港官员进行制裁。
description.en: The U.S. government issued Executive Order 13936, authorizing sanctions against Hong Kong and mainland officials undermining Hong Kong's autonomy.

description.zh-cn: 李家超因被认定损害香港自治，依据第13936号行政命令被列入制裁名单。
description.en: John Lee was placed on the sanctions list under Executive Order 13936 for being determined to have undermined Hong Kong's autonomy.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲议会通过决议，呼吁欧盟理事会制裁李家超等参与侵害香港人权的中港官员。
description.en: The European Parliament passed a resolution calling on the European Council to sanction John Lee and other Hong Kong and mainland officials involved in human rights abuses in Hong Kong.

relationships.target: 反对逃犯条例修订草案运动

description.zh-cn: 作为时任保安局局长，李家超负责领导警队处理和镇压反修例运动中的示威活动，并多次为警方的强硬手段辩护，称其为“止暴制乱”。
description.en: As the then-Secretary for Security, John Lee was responsible for leading the police force in handling and suppressing protests during the anti-extradition bill movement, and repeatedly defended the police's hardline tactics, terming it 'stopping violence and curbing chaos'.

description.zh-cn: 因应美国的制裁令，Google公司旗下的YouTube平台停用了李家超的个人竞选频道。
description.en: In compliance with U.S. sanctions, Google's YouTube platform terminated John Lee's personal campaign channel.

description.zh-cn: 香港末代总督彭定康批评北京当局全面违反了《中英联合声明》的承诺，并讽刺地“鼓励”李家超的家人保留其英国护照。
description.en: Chris Patten, the last British governor of Hong Kong, criticized Beijing for violating the commitments of the Sino-British Joint Declaration and sarcastically 'encouraged' John Lee's family to keep their British passports.

description.zh-cn: 李家超签署了由立法会通过的《维护国家安全条例》，使其正式生效，完成了《香港基本法》第23条的立法工作。
description.en: John Lee signed the Safeguarding National Security Ordinance passed by the Legislative Council, bringing it into effect and completing the legislative work for Article 23 of the Hong Kong Basic Law.
